alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:11PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...River and large stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, large creeks and streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1008 PM EST, The Little Muskingum River and lower portions of Duck Creek and their tributaries are flooding from previous rainfall and snowmelt. Addition rainfall is expected tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marietta and Devola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
